title: Castel Firmian 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: Lightly scented, this straightforward, easygoing wine offers delicate apple and citrus sensations. It's lean but refreshing, with a racy acidity that gives it a crisp, clean finish.

title: Castelfeder 2014 15 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: You'll find light scents of apple, pear and a dose of wet rock on this brisk white that carry over to the rather raw palate. Racy acidity gives it a nervy edge.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2013 Flor d'Englora Roure Red (Montsant)
description: Spicy tomato, rosemary and earth aromas comprise the nose on this basic, scratchy blend of Garnacha and Carignan. Red-fruit flavors combine with mild saltiness in front of a finish with tobacco notes.

title: Ackerman NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: Pale pink in color, this is a crisp, light and bright wine. With its red currant fruits and intense, lively acidity, it's really fresh, fruity and fine as an apéritif.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 Pinta Negra Branco White (Lisboa)
description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is attractive, citrus-driven and light. It has a zesty character that zings through the palate. Drink now.

title: Anterra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and a hint of almond while the bright, fruity palate offers green apple and peach. It's simple but well made.

title: Bel Lago NV Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Streamlined and racy, this nonvintage wine is succinct and to the point. Cranberry and brambly raspberry tones are fresh and lively yet shortlived in this everyday sipper.

title: Bouchaine 2013 Bacchus Collection Terraces Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a dry, tannic estate wine that's rich and ripe with a leathery aspect of gun smoke and blackberry. It shows more in the way of black fruit and spicy pepper than fruit that's delicate or crisp.

title: Byington 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dark pink in the glass, this bubbly is incredibly foamy throughout the experience. It begins with aromas of strawberry, raspberry, plum and red apple, then explodes with bubbles on the palate, which make it hard to find the sour pomegranate and plum-skin flavors that eventually emerge.

title: Haywood 2011 Rocky Terrace Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a particular block of the Los Chamizal Vineyard that is indeed rocky, this brambly, fruity wine shows off layers of blackberry and vanilla, swaddled in cinnamon toast. Somewhat thin on the palate despite the power of its ripeness, it devolves on the sour finish.

title: Klee 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This has a strong impression of sweetness, to the point of being almost cloying. That candied raspberry flavor is offset with citrusy acids, giving it a sweet/tart candy character. The flavors don't quite sync up.

title: Parras Vinhos 2013 Montaria Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: While there is plenty of fruit here, there is also a rustic, barnyard edge that is less attractive. The wood aging has produced some spicy flavors and tannins to give the wine structure.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)
description: There is some of the freshness of the ocean climate in this cool, red fruited wine. It has a fine structure, juicy red berry flavors and fresh, lifted acidity. It's a wine to drink now for its fruitiness and fresh character.

title: Pighin 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Pressed yellow flower and spring orchard fruit are the primary opening scents. The lean palate shows rennet apple skin, lime and a mineral note alongside zesty acidity.

title: Manifesto! 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas are floral and fruity, but also oaky, while flavors add ripe plum and black cherry jazzed up with vanilla accents. This is medium bodied, not very tannic, but packs a good amount of flavor.

title: Gigante 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of toasted nut and yellow apple lift out of the glass. The airy, zippy palate offers unripe pear, lime, almond and mineral alongside brisk acidity.

title: Mezzacorona 2014 Castel Pietra Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Here's a fun and zingy white that offers aromas and flavors of white spring flower, tart green apple and a hint of mineral. It's simple but well made, with zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.

title: Kudos 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is labeled reserve, but has the same early release and light fruit flavors as the less-expensive regular bottling. Cranberry and celery-stalk flavors are the main elements, and the finish turns quite chalky.

title: KWV 2014 Classic Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)
description: Light and easy, this is a direct and straightforward Cab that offers pleasant aromas and flavors of ripe red plum, cherry preserves, raspberry sauce, mocha and baking spice. The soft tannins and fruit-forward palate make this an ideal selection to enjoy now.

title: Lacheteau 2014  Pouilly-Fumé
description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with a herbal character alongside richer yellow and apple fruits. It is fresh and crisp, ready to drink and with a rounded, full aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quattrocchi 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Black fruit aromas come with spice and earth notes. This is saturated to the point of feeling heavy. Herbal raspberry and plum flavors end with grating, scratchy, unresolved tannic grab.

title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Rede Colheita Branco White (Douro)
description: The blend of local Douro white grapes gives a soft wine that has a fine streak of freshness. Citrus is balanced with white peach and shot through with mineral acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)
description: A blend of two really local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is a fresh, mineral and citrus driven wine. It is so light and crisp with acidity that shoots though the wine. From high altitude vineyards, it has a refreshing, cool aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Spicy Vines 2012 Zin Master Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 20% Syrah, then aged almost two years in nearly all-new American oak, this wine is a mouthful of leather and tannin, with a dash of black pepper on the finish.

title: Verterra 2014 Pinot Blanc (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Estery aromas of pear and apple mark the nose. While there's a slight roundness to the palate, sharp acids cut flavors of Granny Smith apple and candied banana short.

title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)
description: A young and fruity wine that is soft with gentle tannins and juicy black currant fruit flavors. It is ripe, fresh and balanced with generous acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Brengman Brothers 2013 Reserve Right Bank Crain Hill Vineyard Red (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Blending 75% Cabernet Franc with 25% Merlot, this wine is mildly aromatic on the nose, showing red cherry, spice and violet. While the palate is medium in weight, a string of acidity cuts short the blackberry and cherry flavors. Grainy tannins build on the finish, with a shock of cranberry and vanilla marking the close.
designation: Reserve Right Bank Crain Hill Vineyard

title: Brengman Brothers 2014 Crain Hill Vineyard Rosé (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Delicate pink in color, this rosé boasts a strawberries-and-cream character, with a jalapeño kick. Showing a touch of breadth on the palate, this light-bodied sipper is an easy choice for an apéritif.

title: Domaine de la Quilla 2013 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Still fresh, even at two-years-old, this is a crisp, apple-scented wine. It has bright acidity that gives the wine a fine tang and mineral edge. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Nerleux NV La Folie des Loups Rosé Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This blend of Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay and Cabernet Franc is ripe and yeasty. It has perfumed fruit, although the fruit is ensconced in a bitter, nutty character. The acidity is intense, giving freshness at the end.
designation: La Folie des Loups Rosé Brut
